place.name: VERNHAMS DEAN
place.gazetteerText: VERNHAM-DEAN, a parish in Andover district, Hants; 7½ miles N by W of Andover r. station. It has a post-office under Hungerford. Acres, 3,486. Real property, with Linkenholt, £5,167. Pop. of V.-D. alone, 727. Houses, 162. The property is much sub-divided. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to Hurstbourne-Tarrant. The church was recently restored. There is a Wesleyan chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
